muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    Usage

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>                n_1       n_2      n_3       n_4       n_5      n_6        n_7
#> sample_1 2.2816118 1.2781197 4.572948  2.446300  3.918070 3.085900  0.6875842
#> sample_2 1.6760680 8.8235642 2.113627  6.955465  5.519662 1.158185  0.7223922
#> sample_3 7.6051816 2.1493004 3.984651 15.787989  4.450012 5.070149 12.5033151
#> sample_4 6.6083664 0.9482377 2.840648  8.697761 10.005007 3.113916  4.9069766
#> sample_5 0.2935901 5.6279017 7.590779  2.325448  4.240354 3.611663  3.6096849
#>                 n_8      n_9      n_10
#> sample_1 13.4076803 3.760881 16.085816
#> sample_2  3.8560604 4.572052  2.962140
#> sample_3  0.9279026 6.254546  1.372819
#> sample_4  6.5543678 1.839749  6.367906
#> sample_5  3.0485593 6.543366  5.905811
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
